title: ðŸš¿ Sanitation Systems (Days 3-4)
goal: Provide safe, hygienic, and sustainable sanitation solutions including a composting toilet and fire bath/shower, suitable for self-setup and low maintenance.

materials.item: Old steel drum (200L) for water heating

steps.title: Select Sanitation Location
steps.description: Choose a site at least 15m from water sources and living areas. Ensure good drainage and privacy.

steps.title: Build Composting Toilet Frame
steps.description: Construct 1.2m x 1.2m x 2.1m timber frame. Include door frame (600mm wide). Ensure frame is square and level.

steps.title: Attach IBR Sheets
steps.description: Secure walls and roof with screws. Overlap sheets to prevent leaks. Seal joints with silicone if necessary.

steps.title: Install Seat Box
steps.description: Construct 450mm high box with hinged top. Cut hole for toilet seat. Sand edges smooth. Ensure stability.

steps.title: Install Ventilation System
steps.description: Run 110mm PVC pipe from below seat to 500mm above roof. Add wind-driven extractor on top to reduce odor.

steps.title: Set Up Bucket System
steps.description: Place bucket under seat. Add ~100mm sawdust after each use. Keep extra buckets for rotation and composting.

steps.title: Build Fire Bath/Shower
steps.description: Position 200L drum on stable bricks. Connect copper piping to shower head. Construct firebox with fire bricks. Ensure water can be safely heated and directed to shower.

steps.title: Install Privacy Screens & Drainage
steps.description: Set poles around shower, attach shade cloth. Add gravel to prevent waterlogging. Ensure proper drainage away from living areas.

steps.title: Inspection & Commissioning
steps.description: Test toilet bucket system for ease of use. Verify ventilation airflow. Light a small fire to check shower heating. Adjust as needed.

tips.content: ðŸ’¡ Always add sawdust after use to reduce odor and aid composting.
ðŸ’¡ Compost buckets should rest in a covered area to prevent rain contamination.
ðŸ’¡ Fire bath can double as water heating for small kitchen use if needed.
ðŸ’¡ Inspect IBR sheet joints monthly to prevent leaks during rain.

safety: Handle IBR sheets with gloves to avoid cuts.
Ensure fire bricks are stable and fire is controlled.
Do not leave fire unattended during water heating.
Keep buckets out of reach of children until fully installed.
